entry.title: SAPfluencer Award 2025 Exciting News !!
entry.content:
As an SAP Data & AI/ML Developer, mentor, and someone passionate about visibility in the SAP community, I‚Äôm thrilled to be part of the jury for the SAPfluencer Award 2025. This award celebrates people who make a real impact in the SAP ecosystem with their ideas, passion, and dedication.

üí°What the Award Is About

  • Visibility & Community ‚ú®
    Highlighting those who bring change in the SAP world‚Äîthrough innovation, community work, content creation, or advocacy.

  • Three Categories üèÜ

    1. Innovation & Tech

    2. Infotainment & Community Engagement

    3. Female Empowerment & Inspiration

  • How It Works üîç

    • Anyone can nominate (yourself or others)

    • The jury selects three finalists per category

    • The audience votes live at the award event

  • When & Where üìÖ
    November 20, 2025 in Bielefeld, at the Grand Stage of the Pioneers Theatre.

‚è≥Nominations Still Open

You can submit nominations until September 15, 2025. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to nominate someone from your network or even yourself!

üôåWhy It Matters

  • Encourages engagement in the SAP community

  • Promotes diversity and empowers underrepresented voices

  • Inspires with different ways to shape the SAP world

üìùMy Jury Perspective

When reviewing entries, I‚Äôll look at:

  • Relevance of contributions

  • Long-term impact

  • Innovation and boldness

  • Authenticity and influence

üöÄFinal Thoughts

The SAPfluencer Award 2025 is more than a prize. It‚Äôs a platform, a voice, and an opportunity to shape the future of the SAP community together.

üëâSubmit your nomination before September 15 and be part of it! More info

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - Integration track sessions
entry.content:
We are days away from the first session of this year's Devtoberfest, our annual virtual celebration dedicated to the SAP developer community. Like previous years, there is a lot going on in the integration space, and as part of Devtoberfest 2025 we will have sessions covering the following topics: Architecture, AI, Event-driven Architectures, Tools for integration developers, open source and more.

As you might be aware, every track is assigned a unique day across the four weeks that Devtoberfest takes place and Wednesdays will be all about integration.

Devtoberfest 2025 sessions

You can find all the different tracks/sessions that are part of Devtoberfest here. You can filter all events by selecting the topic (label) you are interested in, e.g. integration üòâ.

Let me quickly share all the sessions that we will have as part of the integration track:

1st of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • 13:00 - üî¥ Designing understandable SAP BTP Solution Diagrams and contributing to the SAP Architecture Center
  • 15:00 - üî¥ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)

8th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
  • 13:30 - üî¥ Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
  • 17:00 - üî¥ Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell

15th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • 13:30 - üî¥SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring in Context for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)
  • 15:00 - üî¥ Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP open-source project

22th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Future-proof your scripts in SAP Cloud Integration
  • 13:30 - üî¥ A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP

Note: If you click on any of the times of the sessions above, you will download the calendar invite for the session.

So go ahead and RSVP to the different sessions you are interested in. Also, make sure to download the calendar invites so that you don't miss the session and you can get a chance to ask the speaker any questions that you might have about the topic.

Happy learning this Devtoberfest 2025!

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: Exciting Blog Posts, Countdown for Devtoberfest, and More!
entry.content:
One of the best things about September so far is how our platform has many new improvements, active members, features for developers, location groups, and events. There are many reasons to explore and engage inside SAP Community, but this is the type of month that makes everyone feel more excited to learn, connect, and dive deeply into all topics related to SAP.

This SAP Community Voice newsletter highlights some of these updates, summarizes trending topics, explores details about Devtoberfest, and spotlights opportunities to participate in upcoming virtual and physical events, including SAP TechEd.

Read more below to find out what‚Äôs happening in and around SAP Community!

Featured Content

SAP ILM Store Configuration with Microsoft Azure Storage

If you are looking for organized and clear steps on how to configure SAP ILM store with Microsoft Azure Blob, we recommend this content written by @Rahul_Das65. This technical guide covers the prerequisites, authorizations required, certificates, and instructions for testing the connection in the end. To make your life easier, he made sure to include all the sources and useful documents as well.

Read the blog post

AI Agent ‚Äì First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server

This SAP Fiori MCP (Model Context Protocol) server marks a milestone in SAP‚Äôs AI journey by introducing open-source tools for AI coding assistants that you create. In this post, @Christoph_Gollmick explains how MCP helps with large language models (LLMs) to ensure the most reliable results, while also supporting all developers by providing a faster and efficient experience when generating and adapting applications.

Read the blog post

Lessons on SAP Datasphere Architecture

Thinking about building a data solution with SAP Datasphere? This blog post by @haungo can be very helpful. He walks through the steps -- from an initial design to a final, more robust architecture. ‚ÄúLessons learned‚Äù content is always valuable because it provides the insights from the ups and downs of real-world projects.

Read the blog post

New GenAI Feature Available for SAP Integration Suite Version 6.69

SAP¬¥s @DeepakGDeshpande shares details about the new Generative AI based Integration Flow Generation with Mediations Steps feature that boosts the efficiency of the development process. The feature is currently available for the premium edition in specific regions/data centers, but SAP will add more as the rollout of the software feature continues.

Read the blog post

Community News

More Kudos, More Badges

If you‚Äôre an active member who supports other members by giving them kudos, we are now acknowledging your engagement efforts with a new badge progression set. You‚Äôll earn the first badge in the set with your very first kudo, then receive more badges after giving 30 kudos, then 75, 200, and 500 as the final milestone. Check more details in this What‚Äôs New post, which provides a full overview about how this simple act makes such a big impact for our community.

New Design Pilot: We Still Need Your Feedback

In our last edition of SAP Community Voice, we mentioned how we were running a pilot to test a new layout for blog posts that removes widgets and white spaces from the right column, as a way to make the reading experience better. This feature will be available until September 23, so that means another week for you to give us your opinion! You can read more about the pilot in this post and share your feedback in the comments.

New Location Group in Africa

We are so happy that our Middle East and Africa location groups are growing this year. This month we would like to welcome our new Nigeria group, curated by @CharledNwankwo, who has been an active member since 2020. Check now his first blog post on the group here. If you also live in this area, make sure to register to learn and connect with other members from your region and to support future physical events across Nigeria.

Josh Bentley Is Our SAP Community Team Spotlight for September 2025

Our SAP Community team spotlight series features interviews with the SAP colleagues dedicated to our community platform and our members, online and in-person. This month, we are super happy to highlight @josh_bentley (maybe you know him as Josh ‚ÄúBlueBeard‚Äù). In his interview with @fatemehzarei_001, Josh gives the details behind the idea of his iconic colorful beard, explains how he got involved with SAP Community, talks about his current role, and offers advice for those new to SAP and the community. Read the full interview and look for other interviews in the series, spotlighting Anne Kathrine Petteroe, Moshe Naveh, and Laura Schmitz,

New SAP Community Hobbies Series!

Last week, SAP's @moshenaveh launched a new blog series designed to shine a light on the hobbies and passions of community members. The main goal is to encourage you to share a bit about yourself. What topics bring you joy, keep you motivated, and help you balance your life? Participation in this series is a great way to connect with and inspire other members. Starting the series with this post, Moshe highlights walking and hiking, and we want to encourage you to read it and learn more about his adventures. If you have a cool hobby, please join the series and share your story with the community. We would love to hear about it!

Upcoming Events

The Countdown Is On: Two Weeks to Devtoberfest 2025

Is everyone ready for the most expected tech virtual festival? Because Devtoberfest is right around the corner to kick off the big SAP TechEd season! Starting on September 29, this free and online event will be full of sessions and activities, covering different topics such as ABAP, fronted tooling, AI innovations, and CAP. Beyond the educational content, the participants can play around with the fun activities prepared for Devtoberfest (and do not require you to show up at a specific time, allowing you more flexibility to take part in everything). Oh, and let¬¥s not forget that the competition is on, and you should definitely check out all the rules and prizes for the Devtoberfest 2025 Contest.

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder

For all our members who are planning to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin next month and need help to plan on what are the best options to participate (we know it is hard to choose with more than 250 different great sessions), we highly recommend the online agenda builder. This tool allows you to browse through all the sessions available, including keynotes, workshops, roadmaps, and much more. It is very simple to add the ones you are interested in attending to your dashboard and have a clear and clean view. This feature is also available for those participating in SAP TechEd Virtual, so you can plan your schedule whether you're joining in person or online.

SAP Inside Track Around the World

In our last SAP Community Voice newsletter, we highlighted that it's now easier to find local events using the new filter "Country‚Äù. This new feature helps you discover events not directly linked to a location group (e.g., Portugal and Mexico meet-ups can be found even if not represented by a group), as well as events in these groups. Perhaps, if you explore the list, you will see how many SAP Inside Tracks are going to happen in the next two weeks. We highly recommend that you attend if you are looking to connect in person with other members in your area. To help you find these upcoming events more easily: SAP Inside Track Belgium, SAP Inside Track Warsaw, SAP Inside Track Philadelphia, SAP Inside Track Hamburg, SAP Inside Track Porto, SAP SIT RS (Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil).

entry.title: The International 2025 ‚Äì Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid
entry.content:
The International 2025 ‚Äì Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid

From September 11 to 14, 2025, the Barclays Arena in Hamburg became the center of the esports world. The International 2025 (TI14), the most important Dota 2 tournament of the year, brought together the 16 best teams. In addition to the legendary Aegis of Champions, a total prize pool of $2,694,437 was up for grabs ‚Äì funded by Valve's base pool plus community purchases in the Dota client.

Prize pool distribution (Top 4)

Team Falcons ‚Äì approx. $1,181,757 (43.9% of the pool)
ü•àXtreme Gaming ‚Äì approx. $305,163
ü•âPARiVISION ‚Äì approx. $192,000
4Ô∏è‚É£BetBoom Team ‚Äì approx. $128,000
The remaining teams received smaller prize money depending on their ranking.


Viewership & Reach

Peak Viewers: 1.77 million concurrent viewers in the Grand Final.
üìäAverage Viewers: approximately 835,000 over the entire event.
üåçTI14 was broadcast in more than 20 languages worldwide.

This makes TI14 the third most popular Dota 2 event of all time, just behind TI10 and TI11.

Stadium at The International 2025Team LiquidStadiumPublic View on the Ongoing GamesPublic View on the Ongoing Games


SAP & Team Liquid ‚Äì Data in Esports

SAP has been working with Team Liquid since 2018, bringing business technology to gaming:

SAP HANA analytics helped Liquid evaluate over 500,000 draft scenarios and better understand opponents' strategies.
Liquid used statistical models to calculate hero pick probabilities ‚Äì similar to sales or demand forecasts in business.
Even though they didn't make it into the top 4 this year, Liquid was able to show several times during the tournament how data-driven strategies influence drafts and early-game decisions.


Tournament progress ‚Äì facts and figures

16 teams started in the group stage, which was played using the Swiss system.
A total of 51 matches were played, with an average game duration of 42 minutes.
Longest game: 77 minutes in the lower bracket, a real thriller that tested the nerves of both players and fans.
Most picked hero: Shadow Demon (48 picks, 56% win rate).
Highest KDA (kills/deaths/assists): A Falcons player with 14.2 in the Grand Final.


Significance & outlook

TI14 proved that esports and technology are increasingly converging.
For SAP, the partnership with Team Liquid is a showcase for data-driven innovation.
For fans, Hamburg was a worthy venue with a spine-tingling atmosphere.
TI15 will take place in Shanghai in 2026 ‚Äì a venue traditionally known for its vocal fans and gigantic arenas.

 

Conclusion

With over $2.6 million in prize money, nearly 2 million live viewers, and thrilling best-of-five series, TI14 was a worthy milestone in Dota 2 history.
Team Falcons will go down in history as the 2025 champions, while Team Liquid, with the help of SAP data analytics, proves that modern esports is not just about reaction time and instinct ‚Äì but also big data and smart strategy.

entry.title: Step-by-Step Guide to Creating a SOAP API in SAP S/4HANA and Configuring It Using SOAMANAGER
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,
In this blog post, I will walk you through the process of creating a SOAP-based web service in SAP S/4HANA, and demonstrate how to configure and expose it using SOAMANAGER for consumption by external systems.

What is SOAP API ?

SOAP API stands for Simple Object Access Protocol.

It is a protocol-based method of communication that allows different systems to exchange data over a network ‚Äî usually using XML messages over HTTP or HTTPS.

Difference Between SOAP API and Rest API

Feature / Aspect          SOAP API (in SAP)                                    REST API (in SAP)

TechnologyWeb Service (Enterprise Service, Function Module via SOAMANAGER)OData service via SAP Gateway (or RAP in S/4HANA)
Tool UsedSPROXY,SOAMANAGER, SE37SAP Gateway, SEGW, CDS Views, RAP Model.
Data FormatXML onlyMostly JSON (also supports XML)
Typical Use CaseIntegration with legacy systems, middleware, PI/POFiori apps, mobile apps, third-party REST integrations
SecurityWS-Security, SAML, SSLHTTPS, OAuth 2.0, SAML
PerformanceHeavier (due to XML parsing and SOAP envelope)Faster and lighter (especially with JSON)
Contract DescriptionWSDL file.$metadata (EDMX format) via OData.
Preferred InECC or S/4 for BAPIs, ALE, PI/PO scenarios.S/4HANA, Fiori Elements, RESTful integrations.


Step 1:Create a Structure & Table Type for Request and Response.

Objects with the naming convention ZCH* are designed to be transported across all systems (DEV ‚Üí QA ‚Üí PROD).

In contrast, objects with the naming convention YCH* are typically created only for development purposes and are stored in the $TMP package, meaning they are local objects and will not be transported. These may be deleted later.

YCH_CUST_REQ is the request structure.



We need to save in $TMP.

YCH_CUST_REQ_TT is the table type which is consuming YCH_CUST_REQ structure

We are storing the request table type in $TMP

YCH_CUST_RES_S is the Response Payload and stored in the $tmp package




Table type YCH_CUST_RES_TT is the table type & it is consuming YCH_CUST_RES_S and stored in $TMP package.

 

Step2) Creating RFC FM and saved in $TMP Package

So here we are declaring IM_REQUEST as Import parameter with type of Table Type of Request (YCH_CUST_REQ_TT)


So here we are declaring EX_RESPONSE as Export parameter with type of Table Type of Request (YCH_CUST_RES_TT)

There will be no logic written inside the function module only Importing and exporting parameter will be defined

Step 3)Creation of Web service

We need to go for Utilities ->More Utilities->Create web service->From the function Module.

Provide the service definition name and Description

By Default it will take Function module name

By Default it will assign SOAP Appl & Profile


Click on local object check box so that by default it will be assigned to $TMP package

Click on finish to create web service

What is WSDL ?
It is an XML-based language used to describe web services and how to access them. Think of it as a contract between the service provider and the consumer, detailing what the service does, where it can be accessed, and how to interact with it.

Once after that go to WSDL tab and Click on export symbol and download the data in Notepad

So in the WSDL file change the filed type from "tns:char10" to "xsd: String" as below in the downloaded Notepad from WSDL tab.

 


Step 4) Go to Sproxy tcode

Click on New icon to create Service Consumer.

Select the service Consumer radio button


Select External/WSDL schema.

Chose local file

Choose the local file path for the WSDL.

Provide the package with workbench task request & provide the prefix so that we will taken as reference to create a SOAP class.

click on finish

Save the Service Consumer YSRV_SRV_DEF


Change the Release status from Not Released to Released state and Activate the Service Consumer.

So in the External View Tab we can see all Request and Response Fields.



Soap Class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF will be generated automatically which is helpful in sending and receiving the data using the method YCUST_SOAP_API



Step 5) Execute SOAMANAGER Tcode.

An web page will be opened 

Select Web service Configuration

Search our proxy(YSRV_SRV_DEF) in Object type as showed below

We will get the SOAP Class click on that & go for Create -> Manual Configuration

Provide the Logical Port name & description. Click on next

So in Consumer Security Provide the User Id & Password that will be Provided from CPI team (Middleware/Integration Team).

Assign the Endpoint URL which will be Provided from CPI team (Middleware/Integration Team). which will be linked to CPI system.

Change the Message ID protocol to Suppress ID transfer and click on finish.

Once after finishing the soamanger configuration click on the below highlighted icon for Ping the web service.

By pinging the SOAMANGER web service we can Validate our Endpoint, Username & Password.

If it's Successful then we will get the result as below else we will get error.



Step 6)Create a report program that consumes a SOAP API to send and receive data.

REPORT zcv_r_soap_api.
DATA:ls_req TYPE zch_cl_soap_ycust_soap_api,   
     ls_res TYPE  zch_cl_soap_ycust_soap_apiresp.

SELECT FROM kna1 FIELDS kunnr,name1 INTO TABLE (gt_cust).

LOOP AT gt_cust INTO DATA(ls_cust).
  APPEND VALUE zch_cl_ych_cust_req( customer = ls_cust-kunnr name = ls_cust-name1 ) TO ls_req-im_request-item.
ENDLOOP.

DATA(go_ref)  = NEW zch_cl_co_ysrv_srv_def( ).
TRY.
    go_ref->ycust_soap_api(
      EXPORTING
        input  = ls_req
      IMPORTING
        output = ls_res
    ).
  CATCH cx_ai_system_fault INTO DATA(ls_error). " Communication Error
    MESSAGE ls_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
    ENDTRY.

In the  above report program, ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_API and ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_APIRESP are automatically generated structures from the proxy class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF, and are defined as the exporting and importing parameters, respectively, for the method YCUST_SOAP_API.

In the report, I am using the statement APPEND VALUE ZCH_CL_YCH_CUST_REQ at line 8. Here, ZCH_CL_YCH_CUST_REQ is a deep structure that is part of the structure ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_API, which was generated by the proxy class.

Later, we created an object of the class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF, through which we called the method YCUST_SOAP_API. The request data is passed in the structure ls_req, and the response is received in the structure ls_res.

Any errors related to the proxy call will be handled in the CATCH block using ABAP's TRY...CATCH exception handling mechanism.

entry.title: New Intelligent Search Available in Beta Phase
entry.content:
If you take a close look at the search field available throughout SAP Community, you‚Äôll notice a new option in the pulldown: Beta Search. This search introduces several new filtering options, including the ability to filter by SAP Managed Tag and by question status such as unanswered questions (one of the most requested features from members!). 

Powered by Coveo, this new federated search pulls from multiple repositories, not just SAP Community. In fact, this new search will also be available on other SAP sites ‚Äì including SAP.com, SAP Store, and SAP Support Portal ‚Äì with a consistent UI and design, creating a better user experience as visitors navigate across SAP‚Äôs various online destinations. 

You can narrow your search down to specific sites from the top tabs ‚Äì selecting Products, Community, or Support ‚Äì but if you want hits from various platforms, you can refine via the All Results tab. From there, you can click several options under the Document Type dropdown. For example, in addition to the standard options that you would expect for SAP Community (such as Question, Discussion, and Blog Post), you can choose Learning Journey, SAP Knowledge Base Article, and News and Press. 

That‚Äôs a small sample of what‚Äôs available. Looking for training content from SAP Developer Center? Click the Tutorial box. Need material from SAP Help Portal? Select Product Documentation. There‚Äôs even a Video option if you‚Äôre looking for media from SAP channels on YouTube.  

Additional options will allow you to find products directly on the SAP Store site. Depending on the search topic, you may even get an AI-generated answer ‚Äì although the beta results will require additional learning and refinement.  

While the results above may not be completely accurate, all of this search will get smarter over time ‚Äì thanks to you. Coveo relies on a machine-learning model that reacts to user behavior, so your activity will play an important role in improving search outcomes. 

And speaking of outcomes ‚Äì as an SAP Community member, you‚Äôre likely interested in what the search outcomes mean for users trying to find information on our site. We encourage you to test the beta search and see for yourself. You‚Äôll notice some options remain the same, compared to the platform‚Äôs current search ‚Äì such as filtering by date ‚Äì whereas options for searching for users and authors are gone - but will come back with later phases of the search project.

You‚Äôll also find a few new dropdowns, including menus for filtering SAP Community results by specific products and SAP Managed Tags. You can select multiple options from recommendations or search available products and tags to fine-tune results. 

Perhaps most importantly, you‚Äôll be able to filter questions by status (answered, solved, and open), meeting one of the biggest demands from members looking to find (or provide) solutions to problems. 

During the beta phase, you‚Äôll still be able to use the normal SAP Community site search. Results for the beta search will only pull public content ‚Äì meaning you won‚Äôt be able to use it to find information from any private groups (if you belong to any).  

We expect the beta phase to run through the rest of 2025 ‚Äì possibly into the middle of 2026. We‚Äôll provide updates about future phases in What‚Äôs New as they become available. 

Try the new beta search for yourself, compare it to the current search, and leave your questions and observations in the comments below or give feedback via our community inbox community@sap.com. We look forward to your feedback!

entry.title: Update to our Rules of Engagement
entry.content:
We have updated our Rules of Engagement today.

To explain in short what has changed since the last version: 

  • Article 1 now describes the participation etiquette that we expect all community members to follow, as well as outlines the general rules for content publication. For more in-depth information on the participation etiquette and tips for participation in the community, please read this article in our Welcome Corner group. 
  • Article 2 contains information on user profile. 
  • Article 3 describes content which constitutes "Unacceptable Content". Content that is listed in article 3 may either by rejected or removed. The categories here are now aligned with changes the EU made to the Digital Services Act (DSA) categories this year. All abuse reports under article 3 will be subject to DSA.
  • The old article 3 has been removed, which means publishing content about job opportunities and job postings are no longer permitted in the SAP Community.
  • Article 4 has not changed and remains the same. 

With these updates to our rules of engagement, we continue to ensure the best possible content quality and community experience for our members..

entry.title: Thanks for attending SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon ‚Äì A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community
entry.content:
SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon ‚Äì A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community üåôüí°

Yesterday, we had the privilege of hosting  SAP Community Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon, and what an incredible evening it turned out to be! 

The Flow of the Evening üåü

‚ú® A Warm Beginning

The evening began with my welcome to everyone and a brief sharing of the agenda, followed by Jitan Batra and Neeraj Manocha, who painted a vivid picture of the SAP Community journey‚Äîfrom Stammtisch and Tech Nights to Inside Tracks. Their words reminded us that behind every great community lies the spirit of people coming together, sharing, and growing.

‚ö° The Future with SAP Joule
I had the opportunity to present SAP Joule‚Äîexploring its role for developers, consultants, studios, skills, automation, and agents. What struck me most wasn‚Äôt just delivering the session‚Äîit was the spark in the room, the curiosity, and the conversations that followed. The future of work with Joule feels closer than ever.

ü§ñ AI Transforming Support
Nirjar Gandhi then took us on a journey into AI-driven customer support, showcasing tools like Early Watch, Application Conversion Assistant, App Inspector in S/4HANA 2025, and Intelligent Log Analysis. It was one of those sessions that made us realize‚ÄîAI isn‚Äôt a buzzword here, it‚Äôs solving real problems today.

üåç Rise with SAP
Closing the formal sessions, Niharika Razdan spoke about Rise with SAP and how it‚Äôs reshaping ERP. Her perspective on the role of SAP Basis consultants sparked important discussions about career growth, transformation, and the opportunities ahead.

ü§ù Networking & Next Steps
The networking session was buzzing‚Äîpeople exchanging ideas, making plans, and brainstorming about the upcoming SAP Inside Track Gurgaon on 15-Nov-2025. It was community in action, and it felt powerful.

üç¥ Dinner Together
Finally, over dinner, conversations flowed as naturally as the food. Because at the heart of every great community event is not just learning together, but also sharing a meal and building friendships.

Gratitude üôè

  • To the speakers for making the sessions insightful and inspiring.

  • To the attendees from across SAP, IBM, TCS, Accenture, Capgemini, The Silicon Partner, and more ‚Äì for bringing your passion and energy.

  • To SAP Labs Gurgaon ‚Äì for hosting us so warmly.

  • To everyone who supported and organized behind the scenes ‚Äì you made it all possible.

What‚Äôs Next? üöÄ

The excitement doesn‚Äôt end here. With discussions already underway for the SAP Inside Track Gurgaon, we‚Äôre just getting started.

Last night reminded me of this truth: Technology changes fast, but it‚Äôs the people, the community, and the shared learning that make the biggest difference. And that‚Äôs what SAP Community is all about.

üëâ Were you part of SAP Tech Night? Share your favorite highlight or takeaway in the comments‚ÄîI‚Äôd love to hear your perspective!

On behalf of SAP Community NCR

entry.title: Introducing a New Badge Progression Set Just for Bloggers
entry.content:
In August, we launched three new badge progression sets that rewarded members for providing solutions to questions, earning kudos, and giving kudos. Now, after a brief badge hiatus, we‚Äôre back with a brand-new progression set exclusively for bloggers.

The previous sets built upon existing badges that have been available since we launched the new platform last year. To be specific: Before we rolled out those sets last month, members could earn a badge for their first kudo received, their first kudo given, and their first answer accepted as a solution. So we‚Äôve long encouraged ‚Äì and commended ‚Äì those activities. With this new progression set, however, we are returning to recognizing members solely for their blogging.

On our previous SAP Community platform, members could have earned five badges for publishing blog posts: Blogger, Avid Blogger, Skillful Blogger, Master Blogger, and Grand Master Blogger. You may even stumble across these retired badges when you click ‚ÄúView all badges‚Äù on the content page of a long-time member. For example:

We haven‚Äôt had the equivalent of those blog badges on this platform, but that will change as of Wednesday, September 24 ‚Äì the day when we bring back a progression set just for blogging.

This blogging set, like the other sets made available in August, will contain five badges in total. We‚Äôll award the first badge to members who published one blog post, the second to those who published two blog posts, the third to those who published five blog posts, the fourth to those who published ten blog posts, and the final badge to those who published thirty.

We plan to award the badges retroactively, so if you‚Äôre already an active blogger, you can expect one or more badges tomorrow. If you‚Äôd like to know exactly how many you‚Äôll get (if any), you should check your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page to confirm how many blog posts you‚Äôve published. To do that, log in, then select ‚ÄúMy content.‚Äù

Once you‚Äôre on your content page, you‚Äôll notice a gray box at the top. Please ignore it, as the numbers there aren‚Äôt related to the blogging badges. (The ‚ÄúPosts‚Äù number in this gray box does indeed include your blog posts, but it also includes your discussions, comments, and other content types that you‚Äôve posted to the community. So it‚Äôs not the figure used for the blogging set.) Instead, scroll down to the ‚ÄúPrivate Stats‚Äù section and look for ‚ÄúBlog Articles Posted.‚Äù That‚Äôs the number which will determine how many blogging badges you receive. Here‚Äôs an example.

In this case, this member will earn all five badges tomorrow, as his 150 posts exceed all the necessary thresholds associated with this set.

We‚Äôll assign the badges one at a time (from lowest to highest) over the course of a few hours tomorrow, and members will get notifications for each one received ‚Äì so if you‚Äôre like the member in the example above, don‚Äôt be surprised when five notifications come your way.

If you have your notifications turned off (but you‚Äôd still like to monitor your progress tomorrow), then refresh your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page periodically throughout the day. Each time you get a badge, you‚Äôll see it appear in the upper right, as well as on the page accessible from the ‚ÄúView all badges‚Äù link.

If you‚Äôre still waiting for your badges to show up by Thursday, September 25, please log out of SAP Community and log back in. Your badge(s) should be visible then.

Blogging is one of the most important and time-consuming activities available to members, and we‚Äôre happy to recognize our dedicated bloggers once again. If you‚Äôd like to get involved with blogging, start by taking our community tutorial and familiarize yourself with our moderation policy for blogging. We want you to earn those blogging badges ‚Äì and it might be tempting to try to push through thirty posts quickly to max out the set ‚Äì but you should only submit one post at a time, per article 1 of our rules of engagement. Pace yourself, do things right, and you‚Äôll find success as a blogger (with the badges to show for it).  

By sharing their knowledge (or perhaps a little about themselves), community bloggers deliver content that educates and engages our members. This set is just a small way of thanking them. And more thanks are coming. We‚Äôll introduce additional badges soon, so even if you aren‚Äôt a blogger, you may find yourself earning other badges for additional content type contributions in the very near future. Stay active in all areas throughout the community and see what happens. And remember: Even the simple act of leaving a kudo on content that you enjoy can bring you one step closer to a badge. Any positive action in the community, no matter how big or small, makes a huge difference, and these badges demonstrate our appreciation for your quality contributions.

entry.title: Welcome to the SAP Community Casablanca Group! üéâ
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I‚Äôm thrilled to announce the launch of the SAP Community Group in Casablanca - a dedicated space for SAP professionals and consultants to meet, connect, exchange knowledge, and grow together.

Our vision is simple:
‚úÖ Build a vibrant local SAP ecosystem where professionals can network, share experiences, and inspire each other.
‚úÖ Give the SAP scene in Morocco the exposure it deserves through real, value-added events.
‚úÖ Create a sustainable community led by professionals, for professionals.

Why join the SAP Community Casablanca Group?
Here‚Äôs what you can look forward to:
üîπ Local Meetups & Events - informal gatherings, SAP Inside Tracks, and knowledge sessions designed to bring people together.
üîπ Knowledge & Experience Sharing - blogs, discussions, and posts where you can share insights, ask questions, and learn from peers.
üîπ Networking & Growth - meet SAP experts, professionals, and leaders from across Morocco and beyond.

How you can get involved
üëâ Join the Group
üëâ Post your Introduction (tell us about your SAP journey, location, and interests)
üëâ Stay tuned for upcoming events and discussions

This community will only be as strong as its members. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting others, you‚Äôll help us build a solid and sustainable SAP ecosystem in Casablanca.

Together, we‚Äôre creating a place where SAP professionals can connect, exchange knowledge, and create new opportunities - while giving our local ecosystem the visibility and impact it deserves. 

I‚Äôm Younes Elmir, SAP enthusiast student and Community Event Organizer for Casablanca. I launched this group because I believe we can make a real difference by coming together, learning from each other, and showcasing Morocco‚Äôs SAP talent to the world.

We‚Äôve already held our first SAP Community Meetup in Casablanca, and the energy was incredible - more than 20 participants, mostly consultants, all eager to collaborate and shape the future of this community.

Now it‚Äôs your turn:
üí¨ Introduce yourself in the comments - where are you based, what‚Äôs your SAP area, what would you like to see in this community?
üì¢ Share your ideas for topics, events, and activities you‚Äôd like us to organize.

Looking forward to building this journey with you all!

Younes Elmir
SAP Community Event Organizer - Casablanca

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Berlin
entry.content:
PAR107 | SAP and Databricks: Real-time insights and AI without ETL 

Turn your trusted SAP data into AI-driven innovation - without the complexity of ETL. See how the SAP Business Data Cloud solution integrates with Databricks using Delta Sharing to provide more-secure, live access to SAP data for use with AI, data engineering, data warehousing, governance, and BI, and how global enterprises are accelerating value.

DA160 | SAP Business Data Cloud from set up to streamline: A practical walk-through 

Gain practical expertise in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Explore the solution‚Äôs core components, learn how to activate and manage them, and practice strategies to streamline data integration, governance, and access. Find out how to use SAP Business Data Cloud to simplify complex data processes and deliver scalable, trusted data solutions.

DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud 

The SAP Databricks capability, fully native in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, brings scalable AI and ML to enterprise data. This session covers activating SAP Databricks, accessing and sharing governed data, building models, and running secure AI workflows‚Äîbridging data engineering and science without duplication.

DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse 

Explore best practices for modernizing your SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) application with the SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) solution. Learn how to minimize migration risks, keep existing objects in SAP BW, and deliver the objects as managed data products and intelligent applications while using the latest data and AI capabilities in SAP BDC.

DA264 | SAP Business Data Cloud: Explore the analytical components end to end 

Take a hands-on journey through the analytical components of the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Use the SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions to design and build custom scenarios from beginning to end. This session is ideal for technical users seeking to transform data into meaningful business insights.‚ÄÉ

DA205 | A deep dive into SAP as customer zero of SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) 

Discover SAP‚Äôs journey of adopting SAP BDC and its pivotal role in SAP‚Äôs data democratization strategy with Product 360 as an internal frontrunner. Get practical tips from the integration with Databricks and SAP Business Technology Platform as the foundation for adapting, enhancing, and automating key business processes with SAP Business AI.

Not registered yet? Register now: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html

entry.title: The Importance of Cross-Module Knowledge for SAP Consultants
entry.content:
The Importance of Cross-Module Knowledge for SAP Consultants

In today‚Äôs dynamic SAP landscape, being a consultant means much more than mastering your own module. As a functional consultant in SAP MM, I‚Äôve learned over the years that success in real projects often depends on how well you understand the integration points with other modules.

   Why Cross-Module Knowledge Matters

End-to-End Processes: Business processes rarely stop at one module. A purchase order in MM eventually impacts FI through accounting entries, SD when linked to sales, and PP when it involves production. Without cross-module awareness, consultants risk missing critical dependencies.

Better Communication with Teams: Projects bring together FI, SD, PP, WM, and other consultants. Knowing their language and challenges helps avoid misunderstandings and ensures smoother collaboration.

Problem-Solving: Many issues reported by end users appear to be ‚ÄúMM problems,‚Äù but in reality, they stem from integration‚Äîsuch as GR/IR mismatches (MM‚ÄìFI), stock discrepancies (MM‚ÄìWM), or subcontracting issues (MM‚ÄìPP). A consultant with cross-module knowledge can resolve issues faster.

   Key Integration Areas for MM Consultants

MM‚ÄìFI: Inventory valuation, account determination, invoice verification.

MM‚ÄìSD: Third-party order processing, intercompany stock transfers.

MM‚ÄìPP: Material requirements planning, subcontracting, and production orders.

MM‚ÄìWM/EWM: Goods receipt, stock placement, and picking processes.

    Benefits for Your Career

Stronger Profile: Recruiters and clients look for consultants who can think beyond one module.

Added Value: You become a bridge between teams, often reducing delays in projects.

Future-Readiness: In SAP S/4HANA, processes are even more integrated, making cross-module knowledge a must-have skill.

    How to Build Cross-Module Skills

Learn from your colleagues on projects‚Äîask questions, join design workshops.

Explore integration scenarios in a training or sandbox system.

Follow SAP documentation and blogs focused on cross-functional processes.

Share knowledge within your teams and communities to reinforce your learning.

 

Final Thought: Mastering your own module is essential, but expanding into cross-module knowledge transforms you from a ‚Äúconsultant‚Äù into a true process expert. In the end, it‚Äôs not just about configuring SAP,it‚Äôs about understanding and optimizing business processes end to end.
